properties.docString: The actual API key string, which is used as the consumer key when making an OAuth request.
properties.name: apiKey

properties.docString: The application that owns this API key.
properties.name: owner

supportedMethods.GET: Get basic information about the selected API key, including what application it belongs to.

properties.docString: The name of the application as provided by its developer.
properties.name: name

properties.docString: The object types for this object. This set will contain the string C<tag:api.typepad.com,2009:Application> for an application object.
properties.name: objectTypes

properties.docString: T<Deprecated> Hyperlinks for this application.
properties.name: links

properties.docString: The URL of the OAuth request token endpoint for this application.
properties.name: oauthRequestTokenUrl

properties.docString: The URL to send the user's browser to for the user authorization step.
properties.name: oauthAuthorizationUrl

properties.docString: The URL of the OAuth access token endpoint for this application.
properties.name: oauthAccessTokenUrl

properties.docString: The URL to send the user's browser to identify which user is logged in (the "signin" link).
properties.name: oauthIdentificationUrl

properties.docString: The URL of the session sync script.
properties.name: sessionSyncScriptUrl

properties.docString: The URL to send the user's browser to in order to sign out of TypePad.
properties.name: signoutUrl

properties.docString: The URL of a script to embed to enable the user flyouts functionality.
properties.name: userFlyoutsScriptUrl

properties.docString: A URI that serves as a globally-unique id for the object. This can be used to recognise where the same user is returned in response to different requests, and as a mapping key for an application's local data store.
properties.name: id

properties.docString: A string containing the canonical identifier that can be used as the "id" for this object in URLs. However, this should not be used as a database key to avoid collisions when an application is switched to a different backend server; use the "id" property instead.
properties.name: urlId

properties.docString: A URI that serves as a globally-unique id for the user. This can be used to recognise where the same user is returned in response to different requests, and as a mapping key for an application's local data store.
properties.name: id

properties.docString: A string containing the canonical identifier that can be used as the "id" for this object in URLs. However, this should not be used as a database key to avoid collisions when an application is switched to a different backend server; use the "id" property instead.
properties.name: urlId

properties.docString: The URL which is considered to be this asset's permalink. This might be C<null> if the asset does not have a permalink of its own (for example, if it's embedded in another asset), or if TypePad does not know its permalink.
properties.name: permalinkUrl

properties.docString: The user that created the selected asset.
properties.name: author

properties.docString: The time that the asset was created, as an L<http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt|RFC3339> timestamp.
properties.name: published

properties.docString: The raw asset content. The C<textFormat> property defines what format this data is in.
properties.name: content

properties.docString: The content of this asset rendered to HTML. This is currently available only for O<Post> and O<Page> assets.
properties.name: renderedContent

properties.docString: A short, plain-text excerpt of the entry content. This is currently available only for O<Post> assets.
properties.name: excerpt

properties.docString: A keyword which indicates what formatting mode is used for the content of this asset. This can currently be "html" for assets whose content is HTML, "html_convert_linebreaks" for assets whose content is HTML with paragraph tags added automatically, or "markdown" for assets whose content is Markdown. Other formatting modes may be added in future. Applications which present assets for editing should use this property to present an appropriate editor.
properties.name: textFormat

properties.docString: An array of strings containing the id URIs of the groups that this asset is mapped into, if any. At present an asset can only be added to one group, but this may change in future.
properties.name: groups

properties.docString: An object describing the site from which this asset was retrieved, for assets obtained from external feeds.
properties.name: source

properties.docString: T<Deprecated> The hyperlinks for the user object. The "alternate" hyperlink of type "text/html" points at the user's TypePad profile page. This property has been deprecated in favor of the separate link properties defined by the subclasses of O<Asset>.
properties.name: links

properties.docString: An array of object type identifier URIs. At the present time, only one object type is returned per asset, but this may be extended in future. Clients should scan this list and ignore any types that are not recognised. This list also includes appropriate type URIs as defined by the ActivityStrea.ms schema specification.
properties.name: objectTypes

properties.docString: C<true> if this asset is a favorite for the current user, or C<false> otherwise. This property is not set for responses to anonymous requests.
properties.name: isFavoriteForCurrentUser

properties.docString: The number of distinct users who have added this asset as a favorite.
properties.name: favoriteCount

properties.docString: The number of comments that have been posted in the comment tree beneath this asset.
properties.name: commentCount

properties.docString: The title of the asset.
properties.name: title

properties.docString: The description of the asset.
properties.name: description

properties.name: authToken

properties.docString: C<true> if this blog requires users to be logged in in order to leave a comment. If C<false>, anonymous comments will be rejected.
properties.name: signinRequired

properties.docString: C<true> if this blog requires anonymous comments to be submitted with an email address.

properties.docString: C<true> if this blog requires anonymous commenters to pass a CAPTCHA before submitting a comment.
properties.name: captchaRequired

properties.docString: C<true> if this blog places new comments into a moderation queue for approval before they are displayed.
properties.name: moderationEnabled

properties.docString: Number of days after a post is published that comments will be allowed. Absent if this blog has no time limit for comments.
properties.name: timeLimit

properties.docString: C<true> if this blog allows commenters to use basic HTML formatting in comments.
properties.name: htmlAllowed

properties.docString: C<true> if comments in this blog will automatically have any bare URLs turned into links.
properties.name: urlsAutoLinked

properties.docString: An array of object type identifier URIs. At the present time, only one object type is returned per asset, but this may be extended in future. Clients should scan this list and ignore any types that are not recognised. This list also includes appropriate type URIs as defined by the ActivityStrea.ms schema specification.
properties.name: objectTypes

properties.docString: C<true> if this asset is a favorite for the current user, or C<false> otherwise. This property is not set for responses to anonymous requests.
properties.name: isFavoriteForCurrentUser

properties.docString: The number of distinct users who have added this asset as a favorite.
properties.name: favoriteCount

properties.docString: The number of comments that have been posted in the comment tree beneath this asset.
properties.name: commentCount

properties.docString: The title of the asset.
properties.name: title

properties.docString: The description of the asset.
properties.name: description

properties.docString: The total number of items in the whole list of which this list object is a paginated view.
properties.name: totalResults

properties.docString: The items within the selected slice of the list.
properties.name: entries

supportedMethods.POST: Create a new Photo asset within the selected group.

properties.docString: A link to the actual video that provides the primary content for this asset.
properties.name: videoLink

properties.docString: A link to an image which serves as a preview or poster frame for this video. Might be C<null> if such an image is not available.
properties.name: previewImageLink

properties.docString: A URI that serves as a globally-unique id for the user. This can be used to recognise where the same user is returned in response to different requests, and as a mapping key for an application's local data store.
properties.name: id

properties.docString: A string containing the canonical identifier that can be used as the "id" for this object in URLs. However, this should not be used as a database key to avoid collisions when an application is switched to a different backend server; use the "id" property instead.
properties.name: urlId

properties.docString: The URL which is considered to be this asset's permalink. This might be C<null> if the asset does not have a permalink of its own (for example, if it's embedded in another asset), or if TypePad does not know its permalink.
properties.name: permalinkUrl

properties.docString: The user that created the selected asset.
properties.name: author

properties.docString: The time that the asset was created, as an L<http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt|RFC3339> timestamp.
properties.name: published

properties.docString: The raw asset content. The C<textFormat> property defines what format this data is in.
properties.name: content

properties.docString: The content of this asset rendered to HTML. This is currently available only for O<Post> and O<Page> assets.
properties.name: renderedContent

properties.docString: A short, plain-text excerpt of the entry content. This is currently available only for O<Post> assets.
properties.name: excerpt

properties.docString: A keyword which indicates what formatting mode is used for the content of this asset. This can currently be "html" for assets whose content is HTML, "html_convert_linebreaks" for assets whose content is HTML with paragraph tags added automatically, or "markdown" for assets whose content is Markdown. Other formatting modes may be added in future. Applications which present assets for editing should use this property to present an appropriate editor.
properties.name: textFormat

properties.docString: An array of strings containing the id URIs of the groups that this asset is mapped into, if any. At present an asset can only be added to one group, but this may change in future.
properties.name: groups

properties.docString: An object describing the site from which this asset was retrieved, for assets obtained from external feeds.
properties.name: source

properties.docString: T<Deprecated> The hyperlinks for the user object. The "alternate" hyperlink of type "text/html" points at the user's TypePad profile page. This property has been deprecated in favor of the separate link properties defined by the subclasses of O<Asset>.

properties.name: objectTypes

properties.docString: A URI that serves as a globally-unique id for the object. This can be used to recognise where the same user is returned in response to different requests, and as a mapping key for an application's local data store.
properties.name: id

properties.name: urlId

supportedMethods.GET: Get basic information about the selected group.

properties.docString: The name of the noun, as it appears in URLs.
properties.name: name

properties.docString: A mapping whose keys are the HTTP method that this endpoint accepts and whose values are docstrings describing the result of each method.
properties.name: supportedMethods

properties.docString: The names of the query string arguments that this endpoint accepts.
properties.name: supportedQueryArguments

properties.docString: true if this requires expects a format suffix, or false otherwise.
properties.name: formatSensitive

properties.docString: For noun endpoints, an array of property endpoints that it supports.
properties.name: propertyEndpoints

properties.docString: For noun endpoints, an array of action endpoints that it supports.
properties.name: actionEndpoints

properties.docString: For noun endpoints, true if an id part is accepted, or false if the noun may only be used alone.
properties.name: canHaveId

properties.docString: For noun endpoints, true if the id part can be ommitted, or false if it is always required.
properties.name: canOmitId

properties.docString: For filter endpoints, true if a parameter is required on the filter, or false if it's a boolean filter.
properties.name: parameterized

properties.docString: For endpoints that return lists, an array of filters that can be appended to the endpoint.
properties.name: filterEndpoints

properties.docString: The type of object that this endpoint represents for GET, PUT and DELETE operations. This is not returned for action endpoints, since they do not represent resources.
properties.name: resourceObjectType

properties.docString: The type of object that this endpoint accepts for POST operations.
properties.name: postObjectType

properties.docString: For action endpoints, the type of object that this endpoint returns on success. If the endpoint returns no payload on success, this property is null.
properties.name: responseObjectType

supportedMethods.GET: Get information about the selected noun, its sub-resources and their filters.

properties.docString: The name of the type. Absent if this is an anonymous type representing the request or response of an action endpoint.
properties.name: name

properties.docString: The name of the parent type, if any.
properties.name: parentType

properties.docString: The properties of this type.
properties.name: properties

supportedMethods.GET: Get information about the selected object type and its properties.

properties.docString: A list of strings containing relationship type URIs.
properties.name: types

properties.docString: The source entity, the 'subject' of the relationship.
properties.name: source

properties.docString: The target entity, the 'object' of the relationship.
properties.name: target

properties.docString: A RelationshipStatus object describing the types of relationship that currently exist between the source and the target.
properties.name: status

properties.docString: The hyperlinks for the relationship object.
properties.name: links

supportedMethods.GET: Get the status information for the selected relationship, including its types.
supportedMethods.PUT: Change the status information for the selected relationship, including its types.

properties.docString: The total number of items in the whole list of which this list object is a paginated view.
properties.name: totalResults

properties.docString: The items within the selected slice of the list.
properties.name: entries

supportedMethods.GET: Get basic information about the selected relationship.

properties.docString: The user's chosen display name.
properties.name: displayName

properties.docString: The location of the user, as a free-form string provided by the user.
properties.name: location

properties.docString: A list of interests provided by the user and displayed on the user's profile page.
properties.name: interests

properties.docString: The name the user has chosen for use in his TypePad Profile URL. This can be used as the id in the URL to select this user, though it must not be used as a persistent key since it can be changed by the user at any time.
properties.name: preferredUsername

properties.docString: Link to this user's avatar (userpic) image.
properties.name: avatarLink

properties.docString: URL of the user's profile page.
properties.name: profilePageUrl

properties.docString: URL of a page which can be rendered in an iframe to produce a widget through which the remote user can follow this user. Should be rendered in an iframe that's 300 pixels wide and 125 pixels high.
properties.name: followFrameContentUrl

properties.docString: URL of a page at which this user can edit the profile information attached to the user account. This is present only if the remote user has access to do this.
properties.name: profileEditPageUrl

properties.docString: URL of a page at which this user can manage group memberships. This is present only if the remote user has access to do this.
properties.name: membershipManagementPageUrl

properties.docString: URL that the user has specified as an external website URL. C<null> if the user has not provided a website URL.
properties.name: homepageUrl

supportedMethods.GET: Get a more extensive set of user properties that can be used to build a user profile page.

properties.docString: A string containing the canonical identifier that can be used as the "id" for this favorite in URLs. However, this should not be used as a database key to avoid collisions when an application is switched to a different backend server such as the development server; use the "id" property instead.
properties.name: urlId

properties.docString: The owner of this favorite. This is the user that marked the asset as a favorite, not the owner of the target asset.

properties.docString: A reference to the asset that has been marked as a favorite.

properties.docString: The time that the favorite was created, as an RFC3339 timestamp.
